body_html:
Detectron output seems to be correct.

However I get an error when process is finished:
WARNING: Logging before InitGoogleLogging() is written to STDERR
F1106 11:24:24.719717 7636 context_gpu.h:149] Check failed: error == cudaSuccess driver shutting down
*** Check failure stack trace: ***

Not sure if it is builds problem or something of OS/driver level.
This is the detectron's infer_simple.py output anyway in Windows:

Note:
My GPU is GTX 1050 Ti, so I had to use smaller input size and less rpn pre/post nms boxes to have enough memory and reasonable computation time. Obviously. the quality of detectrion of smaller objects is worse in this case.

body:
Detectron output seems to be correct.

However I get an error when process is finished:
WARNING: Logging before InitGoogleLogging() is written to STDERR
F1106 11:24:24.719717  7636 context_gpu.h:149] Check failed: error == cudaSuccess driver shutting down
*** Check failure stack trace: ***

Not sure if it is builds problem or something of OS/driver level.
This is the detectron's infer_simple.py output anyway in Windows:

Note: 
My GPU is GTX 1050 Ti, so I had to use smaller input size and less rpn pre/post nms boxes to have enough memory and reasonable computation time. Obviously. the quality of detectrion of smaller objects is worse in this case.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10763026/48051611-a696d380-e1b6-11e8-9d48-c9a149e5b978.png)
